articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: One-On-One with Gwen Carr
articles.description: Rev. Al Sharpton speaks with Eric Garner’s mother, Gwen Carr about her activism, and her new book titled, “This Stops Today: Eric Garner's Mother Seeks Justice after Losing Her Son.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: #MemoToTrump: Military Edition
articles.description: In this week’s #MemoToTrump, Rev. Al Sharpton he criticizes President Trump for never visiting U. S. Troops in a war zone, and asks him to act more presidential by showing his support for their sacrifices.

articles.title: PoliticsNation 11/24/18
articles.description: PoliticsNation is hosted by Al Sharpton, one of America's most renowned civil rights leader.
articles.content: PoliticsNation with Al Sharpton 11/24/18 PoliticsNation is hosted by Al Sharpton, one of America's most renowned civil rights leader. descriptionLimit">... more Duration: {{video.duration.momentjs}} Up next in: Latest MSNBC videos

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Bishop Michael Curry on his new book: Love is tried and true. We just have to do it.
articles.description: Bishop Michael Curry, who spoke at Meghan and Harry’s royal wedding, has a new book on love called, ‘The Power of Love: Sermons, reflections, and wisdom to uplift and inspire.’ Bishop Curry joins Joy Reid to discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Judy Gold: You need intelligence to understand the intent of a joke, which Trump doesn’t have
articles.description: The next White House Correspondents’ Dinner won’t feature a comedian for the first time in decades, after last year’s comic host apparently upset members of the Trump administration. Joy Reid and her panel discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rev. Dr. Barber: Hyde-Smith jokes about hangings, likely wants to give tax cuts to wealthy
articles.description: The Mississippi U.S. Senate race pits Republican Cindy Hyde-Smith against Democratic hopeful Mike Espy. Can a Democrat win in this GOP stronghold? Joy Reid and her panel discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Mexico deal could put slow down on mass immigration
articles.description: The Trump administration struck a deal with the Mexican government that would require asylum seekers to wait in Mexico as their cases are processed in the United States. Many legal challenges are to come for migrants while waiting in Mexico. NBC’s Julia Ainsl…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Bill Nye: President Trump is ‘doubling down on denial'
articles.description: Scientist Bill Nye join MSNBC’s Alex Witt to discuss the new federal report warning about the impacts of climate change and predictions that damage from extreme weather could cost hundreds of billions of dollars by the end of the century.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Will deal with Mexico change U.S. immigration system?
articles.description: The Trump administration struck a deal with the Mexican government that would require asylum seekers to wait in Mexico as their cases are processed in the United States. The deal has the chance to potentially change the U.S. immigration system.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Will Fischer: Trump has apparently been avoiding combat zones since mid-1960s
articles.description: Donald Trump used his Thanksgiving call with troops to air his political grievances, and did not personally visit active service members of the military or volunteering as presidents such as Barack Obama always did. Joy Reid and her panel discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rula Jebreal: Diplomats say Congress should investigate financial ties between Saudi Arabia, Trump
articles.description: Donald Trump’s ties to Saudi Arabia are under closer scrutiny as many question the reactions of the president after the CIA confirmed Saudi Arabian journalist Jamal khashoggi’s murder was ordered by Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia Mohammad bin Salman. Joy Reid a…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Maya Wiley: We’ve had a lot of lying from folks connected to Trump campaign
articles.description: Roger Stone’s friend Jerome Corsi is reportedly in plea talks with Robert Mueller. Who will be indicted next in the Russia interference probe? Joy Reid and her panel discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Feds release new climate change report as Trump officials downplay it
articles.description: The federal government released a new grim report on the wide ranging effects of climate change, but Trump administration officials are minimizing the stern warnings issued in the report.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: A democratic victory and a 38% president
articles.description: Lawrence looks at the Democrats’ extraordinary victory in the midterms, and whether Republicans will continue to back Trump- or break off ahead of 2020. Joy Reid, Neera Tanden  and Jared Bernstein join.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump Biographer Says President Operates on “Paranoia”
articles.description: “Trump Nation” author Tim O’Brien tells MSNBC’s David Gura that Pres.  Trump can’t have a fact-based argument.

articles.title: Last Word 11/23/18
articles.description: Watch the full episode of Friday night's The Last Word with Lawrence O'Donnell.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump's troubled history with women as candidate & president
articles.description: From the 'Access Hollywood' tape to Stormy Daniels to the Kavanaugh hearings, our panel of Philip Rucker, Tamara Keith, Michael Steele, & Eugene Robinson, discuss Trump's troubled past with women.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: From fixer to flipper: How Cohen changed his tune on Trump
articles.description: Trump's attorney and fixer Michael Cohen once said he would take a bullet for Trump. Fast forward to today, and he's flipped on the president adding to the legal drama surrounding the Trump White House. Philip Rucker, Tamara Keith, Michael Steele, & Eugene Ro…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: A look back at how Mueller's probe has shaped Trump's presidency
articles.description: Nearly 700 days into the Trump presidency, we take a look back and how Russia and the Mueller investigation have been a constant in the Trump White House with Philip Rucker, Tamara Keith, Michael Steele, and Eugene Robinson.

articles.title: The sleeper candidates of 2020

articles.title: Will Beto O’Rourke run for President?
